facts: Last active pharaoh of Ancient Egypt, ruling from 69-30 BCE during the Ptolemaic period
Spoke at least nine languages and was the first Ptolemaic ruler to learn Egyptian
Formed political and romantic alliances with Julius Caesar and later Mark Antony
Was highly educated and known for her intelligence, wit, and political acumen
Established Alexandria as a center of learning with its famous library and lighthouse
Used dramatic entrances and theatrical displays to project power and divine authority
Egypt prospered economically under her rule through trade and agricultural reforms
Her death marked the end of the Ptolemaic dynasty and Egypt's independence from Rome
